quote: I tried it last year and took a DNF. I want to try the 53 again this year, but a friend wants to do the 35-ish route. Last year I rode by myself, and for a good portion of the 41 I finished, I was literally solo, so I'm tempted to just do the 35 to have someone with me...but I'm not sure.

I want to complete the 53 mile route on the Fast Fitty Gravel Race in Charlotte. It was my first race back in 2020 and I bonked at mile 35-ish. Finished the shorter course in 2021, but sat out the next two years with injury and lack of saddle time.

You roll under the banner and onto a mile of blacktop. Good place to sort out the groups before hanging a left onto the gravel where the fun begins... They announced a 'controlled start'....but it felt like anything but. I jumped onto a wheel and we were cruising.

Around 3 miles in... Around mile 5... It will probably be into the wind for a few miles, so tuck into a group and suck some wheels. Closer to 9 miles in the course turns South and is more protected from a Westerly wind.

I saw the main group make the left onto the gravel and I was settling in. I found a people riding my pace and we made the left into the gravel, and the wind... I don't think he liked it much, because he tried to accelerate and drop me. But 2 others latched on with me. We had a small group of 4...
This course is always fast, because the hills are not super tough. The distance starts adding up and the elevation keeps creeping.

Mile 50: Speeds are likely picking up now, as people get set up for the finish. The fast guys are long gone and likely done already....but we still have a few miles to go... Left turn at the cemetery and you are almost done. That left marks the last stretch before the pavement roll into the finish.
Mile 45: Be aware of traffic from the shorter races now
I want to try the 53 again this year... It was my first race back in 2020 and I bonked at mile 35-ish
Last year I rode by myself, and for a good portion of the 41 I finished, I was literally solo, so I'm tempted to just do the 35 to have someone with me
Keep rolling with the punches. This course is always fast, because the hills are not super tough. The distance starts adding up and the elevation keeps creeping.
Mile 15: Its early in the race, but if the heat is ramping up you will feel this section
Mile 15... Its early in the race, but if the heat is ramping up you will feel this section
All proceeds are given to The House of Promise in Lansing, MI
This course is 54 miles and shares 'most popular' honors with The Speedy as we've seen an equal percentage of racers in each race the first 3 years
